channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GaussTR: Foundation Model-Aligned Gaussian Transformer for Self-Supervised 3D Spatial Understanding
item.description: In this paper, we introduce GaussTR, a novel Gaussian Transformer that leverages alignment with foundation models to advance self-supervised 3D spatial understanding.

item.title: Tilted Quantile Gradient Updates for Quantile-Constrained Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Safe reinforcement learning (RL) is a popular and versatile paradigm to learn reward-maximizing policies with safety guarantees.

item.title: MultiLingPoT: Enhancing Mathematical Reasoning with Multilingual Program Fine-tuning
item.description: Since different programming languages excel in different areas, it is natural to use the most suitable language for solving specific problems.

item.title: Track the Answer: Extending TextVQA from Image to Video with Spatio-Temporal Clues
item.description: Video text-based visual question answering (Video TextVQA) is a practical task that aims to answer questions by jointly reasoning textual and visual information in a given video.

item.title: OmniEval: An Omnidirectional and Automatic RAG Evaluation Benchmark in Financial Domain
item.description: As a typical and practical application of Large Language Models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques have gained extensive attention, particularly in vertical domains where LLMs may lack domain-specific knowledge.

item.title: Stochastic interior-point methods for smooth conic optimization with applications
item.description: Conic optimization plays a crucial role in many machine learning (ML) problems.

item.title: Process-Supervised Reward Models for Clinical Note Generation: A Scalable Approach Guided by Domain Expertise
item.description: Process-supervised reward models (PRMs), which verify large language model (LLM) outputs step-by-step, have achieved significant success in mathematical and coding problems.

item.title: SAUGE: Taming SAM for Uncertainty-Aligned Multi-Granularity Edge Detection
item.description: Edge labels are typically at various granularity levels owing to the varying preferences of annotators, thus handling the subjectivity of per-pixel labels has been a focal point for edge detection.

item.title: Locate n' Rotate: Two-stage Openable Part Detection with Foundation Model Priors
item.description: In this paper, we propose a Transformer-based Openable Part Detection (OPD) framework named Multi-feature Openable Part Detection (MOPD) that incorporates perceptual grouping and geometric priors, outperforming previous methods in performance.

item.title: Attentive Eraser: Unleashing Diffusion Model's Object Removal Potential via Self-Attention Redirection Guidance
item.description: To tackle these problems, we propose Attentive Eraser, a tuning-free method to empower pre-trained diffusion models for stable and effective object removal.

item.title: DSGram: Dynamic Weighting Sub-Metrics for Grammatical Error Correction in the Era of Large Language Models
item.description: Evaluating the performance of Grammatical Error Correction (GEC) models has become increasingly challenging, as large language model (LLM)-based GEC systems often produce corrections that diverge from provided gold references.

item.title: BOIDS: High-dimensional Bayesian Optimization via Incumbent-guided Direction Lines and Subspace Embeddings
item.description: When it comes to expensive black-box optimization problems, Bayesian Optimization (BO) is a well-known and powerful solution.

item.title: Lifting Scheme-Based Implicit Disentanglement of Emotion-Related Facial Dynamics in the Wild
item.description: Several DFER methods have highlighted the significance of dynamic information, but utilize explicit manners to extract dynamic features with overly strong prior knowledge.

item.title: Implicit Location-Caption Alignment via Complementary Masking for Weakly-Supervised Dense Video Captioning
item.description: Existing methods rely on explicit alignment constraints between event locations and captions, which involve complex event proposal procedures during both training and inference.

item.title: Noise-based Local Learning using Stochastic Magnetic Tunnel Junctions
item.description: Brain-inspired learning in physical hardware has enormous potential to learn fast at minimal energy expenditure.

item.title: Bidirectional Logits Tree: Pursuing Granularity Reconcilement in Fine-Grained Classification
item.description: This paper addresses the challenge of Granularity Competition in fine-grained classification tasks, which arises due to the semantic gap between multi-granularity labels.

item.title: Learning of Patch-Based Smooth-Plus-Sparse Models for Image Reconstruction
item.description: We formulate the optimization as a bilevel problem.

item.title: PromptDet: A Lightweight 3D Object Detection Framework with LiDAR Prompts
item.description: Recently, multi-modal fusion and knowledge distillation methods for 3D object detection have been proposed to solve this problem, which are time-consuming during the training phase and not friendly to memory cost.

item.title: ASAP: Advancing Semantic Alignment Promotes Multi-Modal Manipulation Detecting and Grounding
item.description: We present ASAP, a new framework for detecting and grounding multi-modal media manipulation (DGM4). Upon thorough examination, we observe that accurate fine-grained cross-modal semantic alignment between the image and text is vital for accurately manipulation detection and grounding.

item.title: Refining Dimensions for Improving Clustering-based Cross-lingual Topic Models
item.description: This component effectively neutralizes the negative impact of LDDs, enabling the model to accurately identify topics across languages.

item.title: Identifying Bias in Deep Neural Networks Using Image Transforms
item.description: To overcome this, we propose a method to identify dataset bias without the need to crop background information from the images.

item.title: CoMPaSS: Enhancing Spatial Understanding in Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Text-to-image diffusion models excel at generating photorealistic images, but commonly struggle to render accurate spatial relationships described in text prompts.

item.title: Structural Pruning via Spatial-aware Information Redundancy for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Within this framework, we introduce a spatial-aware redundancy metric based on feature maps, thus endowing the pruning process with location sensitivity to better adapt to pruning segmentation networks.

item.title: Beyond Data Quantity: Key Factors Driving Performance in Multilingual Language Models
item.description: Our findings identify token similarity and country similarity as pivotal factors, alongside pre-train data and model size, in enhancing model performance.

item.title: ArtAug: Enhancing Text-to-Image Generation through Synthesis-Understanding Interaction
item.description: This enables the synthesis model to directly produce aesthetically pleasing images without any extra computational cost.

item.title: Equity in the Use of ChatGPT for the Classroom: A Comparison of the Accuracy and Precision of ChatGPT 3.5 vs. ChatGPT4 with Respect to Statistics and Data Science Exams
item.description: The most popular of these platforms is ChatGPT, and it has a paid version (ChatGPT4) and a free version (ChatGPT3. 5).

item.title: SemStereo: Semantic-Constrained Stereo Matching Network for Remote Sensing
item.description: In this work, we explore the connections between the two tasks and propose a new network that imposes semantic constraints on the stereo matching task, both implicitly and explicitly.

item.title: Invisible Watermarks: Attacks and Robustness
item.description: Firstly, we examine the application of both image-space and latent-space watermarking methods on a single image, where we propose a custom watermark remover network which preserves one of the watermarking modalities while completely removing the other during decoding.

item.title: EventFull: Complete and Consistent Event Relation Annotation
item.description: Event relation detection is a fundamental NLP task, leveraged in many downstream applications, whose modeling requires datasets annotated with event relations of various types.

item.title: PerSphere: A Comprehensive Framework for Multi-Faceted Perspective Retrieval and Summarization
item.description: As online platforms and recommendation algorithms evolve, people are increasingly trapped in echo chambers, leading to biased understandings of various issues.

item.title: Human-in-the-Loop Generation of Adversarial Texts: A Case Study on Tibetan Script
item.description: How do we generate adversarial texts for less-studied languages?

item.title: Queries, Representation & Detection: The Next 100 Model Fingerprinting Schemes
item.description: To foster the creation of new fingerprinting schemes and benchmarks, we open-source our fingerprinting toolbox.

item.title: Are Your LLMs Capable of Stable Reasoning?
item.description: The rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has demonstrated remarkable progress in complex reasoning tasks.

item.title: Unsupervised UAV 3D Trajectories Estimation with Sparse Point Clouds
item.description: Compact UAV systems, while advancing delivery and surveillance, pose significant security challenges due to their small size, which hinders detection by traditional methods.

item.title: SnakModel: Lessons Learned from Training an Open Danish Large Language Model
item.description: We present SnakModel, a Danish large language model (LLM) based on Llama2-7B, which we continuously pre-train on 13. 6B Danish words, and further tune on 3. 7M Danish instructions.

item.title: Algorithmic Fidelity of Large Language Models in Generating Synthetic German Public Opinions: A Case Study
item.description: In recent research, large language models (LLMs) have been increasingly used to investigate public opinions.

item.title: Versatile Ordering Network: An Attention-based Neural Network for Ordering Across Scales and Quality Metrics
item.description: However, the optimization problems related to ordering are often difficult to solve (e. g., TSP is NP-complete), and developing specialized optimization algorithms is costly.

item.title: VidTok: A Versatile and Open-Source Video Tokenizer
item.description: Encoding video content into compact latent tokens has become a fundamental step in video generation and understanding, driven by the need to address the inherent redundancy in pixel-level representations.

item.title: RCTrans: Radar-Camera Transformer via Radar Densifier and Sequential Decoder for 3D Object Detection
item.description: In radar-camera 3D object detection, the radar point clouds are sparse and noisy, which causes difficulties in fusing camera and radar modalities.

item.title: Subspace Implicit Neural Representations for Real-Time Cardiac Cine MR Imaging
item.description: Conventional cardiac cine MRI methods rely on retrospective gating, which limits temporal resolution and the ability to capture continuous cardiac dynamics, particularly in patients with arrhythmias and beat-to-beat variations.

item.title: Faster Vision Mamba is Rebuilt in Minutes via Merged Token Re-training
item.description: Re-training the token-reduced model enhances the performance of Mamba, by effectively rebuilding the key knowledge.

item.title: ChatDiT: A Training-Free Baseline for Task-Agnostic Free-Form Chatting with Diffusion Transformers
item.description: Building upon this foundation, we present ChatDiT, a zero-shot, general-purpose, and interactive visual generation framework that leverages pretrained diffusion transformers in their original form, requiring no additional tuning, adapters, or modifications.

item.title: DuSSS: Dual Semantic Similarity-Supervised Vision-Language Model for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Vision-Language Model (VLM) has great potential to enhance pseudo labels by introducing text prompt guided multimodal supervision information.

item.title: Label Errors in the Tobacco3482 Dataset
item.description: Tobacco3482 is a widely used document classification benchmark dataset.

item.title: Harnessing Event Sensory Data for Error Pattern Prediction in Vehicles: A Language Model Approach
item.description: In this paper, we draw an analogy between processing natural languages and processing multivariate event streams from vehicles in order to predict $\textit{when}$ and $\textit{what}$ error pattern is most likely to occur in the future for a given car.

item.title: DriveTester: A Unified Platform for Simulation-Based Autonomous Driving Testing
item.description: However, one of the key challenges in ADS testing is the complexity of preparing and configuring simulation environments, particularly in terms of compatibility and stability between the simulator and the ADS.

item.title: CREST: An Efficient Conjointly-trained Spike-driven Framework for Event-based Object Detection Exploiting Spatiotemporal Dynamics
item.description: Event-based cameras feature high temporal resolution, wide dynamic range, and low power consumption, which is ideal for high-speed and low-light object detection.

item.title: AIR-Bench: Automated Heterogeneous Information Retrieval Benchmark
item.description: The testing data in AIR-Bench is generated with respect to diverse tasks, domains and languages.

item.title: Assessing the Limitations of Large Language Models in Clinical Fact Decomposition
item.description: Verifying factual claims is critical for using large language models (LLMs) in healthcare.

item.title: Evaluating Zero-Shot Multilingual Aspect-Based Sentiment Analysis with Large Language Models
item.description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA), a sequence labeling task, has attracted increasing attention in multilingual contexts.
